intro: Roemeria latiloba, commonly known as the broad-leaf roemeria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Roemeria latiloba is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate foliage and flowering display.
